H0.text: What name is given to a substance that accelerates a chemical reaction without itself being affected. Accelerant

H1.text: What name is given to a substance that accelerates a chemical reaction without itself being affected. Reactant

H2.text: What name is given to a substance that accelerates a chemical reaction without itself being affected. Enabler

H3.text: What name is given to a substance that accelerates a chemical reaction without itself being affected. CATALYST

A4.text: Catalysis is the increase in rate of a chemical reaction due to an added substance known as a catalyst.

A5.text: Catalysts are not consumed by the reaction and remain unchanged after the reaction.
